chart.title: Modern renewable electricity generation by source
chart.subtitle: Measured in [terawatt-hours](#dod:watt-hours).
chart.note: "Other renewables" include geothermal, wave, and tidal energy.
chart.citation: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025)

Electricity from wind - TWh.descriptionProcessing: - While the Energy Institute (EI) provides a longer time series (dating back to 1965) than Ember (dating back only to 1990 for European countries and 2000 for other countries), EI does not cover all countries or all sources of electricity (for example, generation from bioenergy is missing). Therefore, when data from Ember is available for a given country and year, we use it as the primary data source. Where Ember data is unavailable, we supplement it with data from EI.
Electricity from wind - TWh.citationShort: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Electricity from wind - TWh.citationLong: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Electricity generation from wind power” [dataset]. Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data”; Energy Institute, “Statistical Review of World Energy” [original data].
